boards.title: Touch it Dumbass (Ending)
boards.text:
Curiosity gets the better of you, and you reach out to touch it. Upon contact, you feel it race down your arm, and up your shoulder. Its cool yet slimy texture makes contact with your neck. You go to scream only for it to climb up your chin and pour into your mouth and nostrils! This is a nightmare, right? Everything begins to go black and you collapse to the ground.

………..You Slowly wake up, still collapsed against the floor, but you seem to be unharmed. Was it all a dream, you begin to walk down the hallway and as you walk you look down and notice that most of your work uniform is torn up. Not only that, but you seem to have misplaced your Fusion Torch. Whatever is going on you cannot explain, but at least you are still alive. You check your front pocket, and a sigh escapes your lips. You still have the keycard. You go to head for the staircase, only to make it a few steps out of the Jail Room when you drop the card. Your hand begins to violently shake as you notice parts of your skin begin to bulge and bubble. Something is moving beneath your skin and you feel it crawl up your arm once more. You were not dreaming. You want to vomit as you feel it churn your insides, and the last thing you see is red. 
You died “One of Them” -Ending
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Run
boards.text: You quickly back peddle your way out of the cell, before turning and getting to your feet. You run towards the door and hurry out into the hallway. You hear its slimy substance stumbling closer as if it is barreling through the Jail room. You need to get some distance, you are still lugging the Fusion Torch and could attempt to blast it, perhaps it would slow it down.

boards.title: New Board 113
boards.text:
You are sick of these games, your goofy grin still plastered on your face you lift up your Fusion Torch. Its weightiness still unfamiliar to you and as you pull the trigger you hear it begin to whir to life. Its noise is unfamiliar to you and you lift up the weapon, aiming right at the monstrosity. Before you know it you get sent flying backwards into a wall. The kickback of the weapon was so powerful that it sent you temporarily skyborn as the weapon blasted a bright ball of light at the creature. Where the light hits gets vaporized in an instant, leaving nothing but a charred stain on the ceiling where you shot it. 
Your joy is only momentarily lived though as the the pieces of purple sludge slowly begin to merge back together forming an even bigger thing than earlier. You see as it slowly stretches itself towards the ground before it finally makes contact. Once it is partially on the ground, it just begins to expand and grow in size before it is towering over you.

boards.title: Run - has not use fusion torch
boards.text: You quickly back peddle your way out of the cell, before turning and getting to your feet. You run towards the door and hurry out into the hallway. You hear its slimy substance stumbling closer as if it is barreling through the Jail room. You need to get some distance, you are still lugging the Fusion Torch and could attempt to blast it again, perhaps it would slow it down.

boards.title: New Board 132
boards.text: In peer panic, you lift up your Fusion Torch towards the creature. The Torch’s weightiness still unfamiliar to you and as you pull the trigger you hear it begin to whir to life. Its noise is unrecognizable and you aim it right at the monstrosity. Before you know it you get sent flying backwards out of the cell. The kickback of the weapon was so powerful that it sent you temporarily skyborn as the weapon blasted a bright ball of light at the creature. You do not see what happens but as you slowly look up from where you are lying you notice what you did. The monster has stopped in its tracks and there is a huge “U” like impression on the creature where you hit it. Where the mass had vanished begins to ungulate and convulse as it slowly regenerates what it lost. The creature has momentarily stopped in its tracks as it slowly regains its form. Sadly you are lying still on your back recovering from the whole experience. You pull yourself up, it’s now or never and there is not much left that you can do.

boards.title: Use torch first time
boards.text: You turn on a dime and lift up the Fusion Torch. Its weightiness still unfamiliar to you and as you pull the trigger you hear it begin to whir to life. Its noise is unrecognizable and you aim it right at the monstrosity. Before you know it you get sent flying backwards further down the hall. The kickback of the weapon was so powerful that it sent you temporarily skyborn as the weapon blasted a bright ball of light at the creature. You do not see what happens but as you slowly look up from where you are lying you notice what you did. The monster has stopped in its tracks and there is a huge “U” like impression on the creature where you hit it. Where the mass vanish begins to ungulate and convulse as it slowly regenerates what it lost. The creature has momentarily stopped in its tracks as it slowly regains its form. Sadly you are lying still on your back recovering from the whole experience. You pull yourself up, it’s now or never and there is not much left that you can do.

boards.title: Ending 1
boards.text:
You drop the Torch, believing it will weigh you down, and quickly rush down the hallway. Your legs pumping beneath you as you run as fast as you can. You can hear the slime creature behind you, its fleshy-like body slapping against the ground as it twists and ungulates, gaining more and more ground against you. Almost there, you see the staircase entrance. Fumbling with your pocket, you manage to pull out your keycard. Swiping it, you gain access and enter the staircase. Just in time too, as the slime creature flies by, before it too begins to flood into the stairway. You are running up the steps as it is coming behind you. You can hear it getting closer, it is now pouring into the stairway, stacking its body on itself, like a rotating wheel as it is making its way up the stairs. You reach for the knob and stumble through pushing the door close behind you. A sigh escapes your lips as you back away slowly, expecting the monstrosity to barge through, but instead, you are greeted by an unsettling quietness. Although it feels unsettling, you feel a sense of calmness wash over you. You collapse to your knees in exhaustion.
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Keep running
boards.text: You continue to hobble your way down the hall. Moving with such a cumbersome object is a struggle. As you make your way down the hall, you can see the stairway in the distance. Almost there, a feeling of hope washes over you but is quickly replaced with panic as you feel a tug on your jacket. The monster has caught up to and one of its tendrils has latched partially onto your work jacket.

boards.title: Has shot the weapon
boards.text: You quickly back peddle your way out of the cell, before turning and getting to your feet. You run towards the door and hurry out into the hallway. You hear its slimy substance stumbling closer as if it is barreling through the Jail room. You need to get some distance, you are still lugging the Fusion Torch and could attempt to blast it again, perhaps it would slow it down.

boards.title: Shoot it again
boards.text: You lift up your weapon once more, aiming true you pull the trigger. A familiar hum begins to emanate from the weapon. You are unsure how many more times you can use it, but you do know that it packs a punch. This time bracing yourself, the gun releases and you get a clear look at it. It launches a bright projectile that phases through a part of the monster, and in an instant, that section of the creature vanishes. It rips away anything part of the creature making the mass fall further to the ground. Where the mass vanish begins to ungulate and convulse as it slowly regenerates what it lost. The creature has stopped in its tracks as it slowly regains its form.

boards.title: Death Ending 1
boards.text:
As you try to pull yourself away from the creature, it only feels like it is pulling itself closer to you. You turn and go to swing the butt of your weapon at it, only for it to bounce off as if unaffected.  This along with another tug makes you lose your footing as the monster is now upon you. It towers over you as you continue to get tangled within the tendril. Your sight slowly fades away as the creature crashes upon you. Darkness takes you and you feel everything drift away. 
You have died, at first, I thought of not including these, but as I wrote I felt that sometimes endings like these just occur. I was going to have a way to just go back to where you were, but I feel that takes away from how I view this game. We cannot control life, or death, and the choices we make truly do matter. Thank you for playing this demo and feel free to contact us to leave any feedback. If you truly want to play again, simply press the restart button at the top left of the site and it will let you live another life. Perhaps you will find a different more satisfying answer.

boards.title: Ending 3
boards.text:
As a last-ditch effort, you pull yourself free from your jacket, just in time as you watch it get devoured by the creature. The clothing disappears into the disgusting ooze as if it never existed. Now turning, you make a break for it. Your legs pumping beneath you as you rush for the stairs, one arm around your weapon as the other reaches down for your keycard.
Fumbling about, you eventually get the card out and are able to open the holographic door and enter the stairway. Just in time as you hear the ooze fly by before it too begins to pour in. You reach for the knob and stumble through pushing the door close behind you. A sigh escapes your lips as you back away slowly, your weapon aimed and ready expecting the monstrosity to barge through the door. Instead, you are greeted by an unsettling quietness. Although it feels unsettling, you feel a sense of calmness wash over you. You collapse to your knees in exhaustion. You made it, you survived. 
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.
Attempt get off

boards.title: Shoot that thing
boards.text: The creature is gaining on you, its slimy mass pouring through pulling itself out of the room as it drags its body across the hallway. From the giant purple substance, many long slimy-like tendrils extend out of it, making contact with the walls as it pulls itself across. You know you have no choice but to use the Torch, turning around while pulling the trigger, a familiar hum begins to emanate from the weapon. You are unsure how many more times you can use it, but you do know that it packs a punch. This time bracing yourself, releases and you get a clear look at it. It launches a bright projectile that phases through a part of the monster, and in an instant, that section of the creature vanishes. As if it was never there it leaves a “U” like impression on the creature. Where the mass vanishes begins to ungulate and convulse as it slowly regenerates what it lost. The creature has stopped in its tracks as it slowly regains its form.

boards.title: End 2
boards.text:
In a peer panic, you turn and hurl your weapon directly at the sludge-like creature. You watch in horror as it lifts its body in a wave-like shape and consumes the weapon as if it were never there. Now with no weapon though, you are actually quite light on your feet and are able to create enough distance between you and the monster. You continue running, your legs pumping beneath you as you reach down, fumbling for the keycard.
 Making it to the stairway, you turn back and see the sludge-like monster barreling towards you. Its massive form is hard to take in as it contorts and twists as if reshaping itself constantly as it moves. In a panic, you tap the keycard against the sensor of the stairway security door. The holographic security shuts off allowing you to rush up the stairs. You can hear the sludge as it floods past the stairway and begins to pour in. You run up the stairs and see a doorway at the top. Almost there, just a few more steps. You reach for the knob and stumble through pushing the door close behind you. A sigh escapes your lips as you back away slowly, expecting the monstrosity to barge through, but instead, you are greeted by an unsettling quietness. Although it feels unsettling, you feel a sense of calmness wash over you. You collapse to your knees in exhaustion. You made it, you survived. 
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Run after second shot
boards.text:
You turn around and begin sprinting down the hallway. You may have created some momentary distance with that shot, but you know it won’t last long. Whatever this thing is, it is not natural. You can hear it reshaping and you turn and notice it regenerating the hole you left in it. 
“You got to be kidding me,” you mutter under your breath as you continue to hobble your way down the hall. Moving with such a cumbersome object is a struggle. As you make your way down the hall, you can see the stairway in the distance. Almost there, a feeling of hope washes over you but is quickly replaced with panic as you feel a tug on your jacket. The monster has caught up to and one of its tendrils has latched partially onto your work jacket.

boards.title: Shoot it Again
boards.text:
Fuck this thing. You are not going to die here! Bracing yourself you go to fire again. The weapon begins to whir and rattle slightly in your hands as you expect it to release another bright projectile. Instead, you hear a sharp mechanical hiss as steam begins to emit from the torch’s sides. Nothing else happens and you go to fire again, and nothing continues to happen. 
	It seems you may have blown the core of your Fusion Torch. As you stand there dumbfounded in utter disbelief, you don’t notice that the creature has now fully regenerated and is upon you. In an instant you are knocked off your feet, your weapon being swallowed whole by the creature as it continues its onslaught. Multiple of its sludgy-like tendrils squirm towards you.

boards.title: New Board 124
boards.text: You are not dying here! You go to kick one of the tendrils away, expecting to make contact with your foot, but instead, it simply recoils in on itself before enveloping your foot. The sludge-like substance begins to quickly climb up your boot, you need to act fast.

btns.l: Kick it with your other foot

boards.title: Ending 1
boards.text:
You are not dying here! You begin to crawl away as it starts working its way towards you once more. The tendrils are getting closer, but you regain your footing and begin running down the hall, barely avoiding one of the tendrils. As you run down the hall, you see the stairway. The only way to the second floor now lies in front of you and as you continue running, it feels like you may never make it.
You continue running though, your legs pumping beneath you as you reach down, fumbling for the keycard. Making it to the stairway, you turn back and see the sludge-like monster barreling towards you. Its massive form is hard to take in as it contorts and twists as if reshaping itself constantly as it moves. In a panic, you tap the keycard against the sensor of the stairway security door. The holographic security shuts off allowing you to rush up the stairs. Just barely avoiding the sludge as it floods past you. You run up the stairway and see a doorway at the end. Almost there, just a few more steps. You can hear it getting closer, it is now pouring into the stairway, stacking its body on itself, like a rotating wheel as it is making its way upstairs. You reach for the knob and stumble through pushing the door close behind you. A sigh escapes your lips as you back away slowly, expecting the monstrosity to barge through, but instead, you are greeted by an unsettling quietness. Although it feels unsettling, you feel a sense of calmness wash over you. You collapse to your knees in exhaustion.

Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Still alive
boards.text:
You go to remove your boot as the purple substance continues to envelop your foot. 
“Get off me!” You yell as you are successful in sliding your foot out of the boot. Good thing to do as it swallows your boot whole and continues to work its way towards you. You crawl backward trying to regain some footing, but with one shoe off and this creature at your heels, it is hard to make any headway. You slip as you go to stand up, but are able to retain your footing. You got to run, but feel another sharp tug, this one on your work jacket.

boards.title: Fighting Spirit ending
boards.text:
You go to kick it with your other foot, only for it too to become consumed by the strange slimy substance. It begins to climb up your body until it is covering most of you. You go to scream only for it to pour into your mouth and nostrils, and before you can do anything the rest of the purple ooze collapses on top of you similar to a wave. Darkness consumes you.
You have died - Earned “The Fighting Spirit Ending”
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.

boards.title: Death Ending 1
boards.text:
As you try to pull yourself away from the creature, it only feels like it is pulling itself closer to you. You turn and go to grab the tendril, only for your hand to get entangled in the slimy substance. This along with another tug makes you lose your footing as the monster is now upon you. It towers over you as you continue to get tangled within the tendril. Your sight slowly fades away as the creature crashes upon you. Darkness takes you and you feel everything drift away. 
You have died, at first, I thought of not including these, but as I wrote I felt that sometimes endings like these just occur. I was going to have a way to just go back to where you were, but I feel that takes away from how I view this game. We cannot control life, or death, and the choices we make truly do matter. Thank you for playing this demo and feel free to contact us to leave any feedback. If you truly want to play again, simply press the restart button at the top left of the site and it will let you live another life. Perhaps you will find a different more satisfying answer.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
You brace yourself this time as you lift up the Fusion Torch once more, a familiar whirring noise occurs as you press the trigger. The creature is slowly regenerating before you blast it again. This one vaporizes its left side making the sludge-like ooze fall to the ground in a pile of heap. As a result, it begins to release a strong sulfuric smell that causes you to turn away. Within this slightly enclosed space though, your weapon is still producing enough heat and as if in a chain reaction, blows the whole cell sky-high. As if in a flash, it all blows a giant hole in the side of the ship. 
		You died, “Going out in a Blaze of Glory” - Ending
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Run
boards.text: You turn and bolt out of the room, you do not know how much time you may have, but you are going to take this opportunity to create as much space between you and that thing as possible. Running out of the Jail Room and up the hallway, you can hear it barreling through the Jail room as it has already recovered from your prior attack. You are almost there to the stairway. Your heart is pumping, and you find it quite hard to run with the Fusion Torch in hand. The sounds of the slide-like monster are getting louder, you can hear it getting closer.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
Desperate times call for desperate measures. Whether it was bravery or stupidity, or maybe even fear you do not know what drove you to turn around. As you turn, pulling the trigger and bracing yourself, you fire. Not a perfect shot, but it is enough. The energy behind the blast almost knocks you off your feet and you watch the bright projectile vaporize half of the sludge-like monster in an instant. It twists and contorts on itself, as if it too is shocked by the whole outcome. You see it in an instant turn itself into a more liquidity form before retreating into the seams of the walls. Shock turns to frustration as a part of you does not want to let it escape and you go to shoot it once more. Instead, you are only greeted by a different more mechanical hiss noise as nothing else happens. It seems you may have blown part of the core of the Fusion Torch, but it is probably for the best. This…creature, or…thing, or whatever it was could not be killed so easily, and you are lucky it decided to retreat. You slowly back your way towards the stairs, making sure the creature does not come back. After swiping your keycard, you make your way up the stairs and up to the second floor. 
You survived
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
You turn and run for the exit, not bothering to see what is left of the ooze-like monster. Instead, you rush to the stairway, using your keycard to gain access before running up the steps. You are not going to tempt fate and look back. As you near the top, a door greets you. You quickly barge through before closing it behind you. Slumping against it, exhaustion washes over you as you slowly fall to the ground. You made it, you survived...
Thank you for playing our demo, feel free to contact us if you have any feedback. If you would like another round, feel free to hit that refresh button at the top left of the site. Besides that thank you...don't look behind you

boards.title: Ending 4
boards.text:
The weapon whirs once more to life and you hear a different noise. The noise is like a sharp mechanical hiss as steam begins to emit from the torch’s sides. Nothing else happens and you go to fire again, and nothing continues to happen. You feel a mixture of frustration and dread as you expect the creature to regenerate its form and attack you. Instead, though you notice it is...retreating. You see a much smaller blob now than before, as it slowly pulls itself away.Odd but with everything else going on, this is a victory in your book. You slowly make your way down the hall, still vigilant of course. Expecting at any moment for the creature to come out of a pipe, or a crack in the ceiling and attack you once more, but none of this occurs. You make it to the stairway and successfully swipe your keycard to access the second floor. You ascend the steps, a door greets you at the top. You open it and are greeted...

You survived, "Live for Another Day" Ending.

Thank you for playing our demo, feel free to contact us if you have any feedback. If you would like another round, feel free to hit that refresh button at the top left of the site. Besides that thank you...don't look behind you

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
Curiosity gets the better of you, and you reach out to touch it. Upon contact, you feel it race down your arm, and up your shoulder. Its cool yet slimy texture makes contact with your neck. You go to scream only for it to climb up your chin and pour into your mouth and nostrils! This is a nightmare, right? Everything begins to go black and you collapse to the ground.

………..You Slowly wake up, still collapsed against the floor, but you seem to be unharmed. Was it all a dream, you begin to walk down the hallway and as you walk you look down and notice that most of your work uniform is torn up. Whatever is going on you cannot explain, but at least you are still alive. You check your front pocket, and a sigh escapes your lips. You still have the keycard. You go to head for the staircase, only to make it a few steps out of the Jail Room when you drop the card. Your hand begins to violently shake as you notice parts of your skin begin to bulge and bubble. Something is moving beneath your skin and you feel it crawl up your arm once more. You were not dreaming. You want to vomit as you feel it churn your insides, and the last thing you see is red. 
You died “One of Them” -Ending
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.text: You quickly back peddle your way out of the cell, before turning and getting to your feet. You run towards the door and hurry out into the hallway. You hear its slimy substance stumbling closer as if it is barreling through the Jail room. You need to get some distance,

You continue running, your legs pumping beneath you as you rush down the hallway. You can hear the slime creature behind you, its fleshy-like body slapping against the ground as it twists and ungulates, gaining more and more ground against you. You look behind you and cannot even describe what you are seeing. A giant purple ooze-like monstrosity contorting in on itself as it is moving at tremendous speeds right towards you. Almost there, you see the staircase entrance. Fumbling with your pocket, you manage to pull out your keycard. Swiping it, you gain access and enter the staircase. Just in time too, as the slime creature flies by, before it too begins to flood into the stairway. You are running up the steps as it is coming behind you. You can hear it getting closer, it is now pouring into the stairway, stacking its body on itself, like a rotating wheel as it is making its way up the stairs. You reach for the knob and stumble through pushing the door close behind you. A sigh escapes your lips as you back away slowly, expecting the monstrosity to barge through, but instead, you are greeted by an unsettling quietness. boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
You stumble down the hallway before locking yourself into the morgue. You step back from the door, expecting the monstrosity to barge through. Slowly backing up, you believe you were able to lose it. The lights to the Morgue suddenly begin to flicker, before cutting off entirely. You nervously back up until feel your back make contact with a weird slimy substance. When the lights suddenly flicker back on, you look behind you and are greeted by the giant grotesque monstrosity. Before you can do anything, its tendrils launch forward coiling around you. You feel it pull you off your feet, before pulling you into its body. The last thing you see is only darkness.
You died
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: New Board 205
boards.text:
You press your weight against the door, the weight of impending doom setting in. 
 You hear the monster roar before you feel it throw itself against the door. Looking around yourself you realize this might be it. The room is in tatters, the remnants of the shattered cage just reminding you of your earlier fault.
Amidst all this despair, a glimmer of hope catches your eye- a key, the key that you had seen earlier. It lies within reach, and with trembling fingers, you snatch it up. You feel a new sense of hope as desperation fuels your resolve as you scan the room once more. 
As you scan, a plan begins to form from all the chaos. With swift action you remove yourself from the door, and unravel a tattered curtain, fashioning the torn fabric into a makeshift snare and bindings. You can hear the monster breaking the door down as you weave a tangled labyrinth of obstacles for the creature’s path.
You stand near the broken cage with bated breath, watching as the creature bursts into the room. It sees you and lunges at you, only for its movements to be cut short as it gets tangled in a web of curtains. You seize the opportunity and dash past the thrashing creature. Key clutched tightly, you insert it into the room across and it unlocks. You are greeted then by a bright light

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
With urgency, you dart over to the cabinet, the creature’s onslaught against the door adding to your stress. You wrench the cabinet from its rating place, dragging it across the grimy floor. The cabinet is about half your size and fits snuggle beneath the door handle, keeping the door from caving in on itself.
You step back realizing there is nothing else you can do. The door shudders from the impact of the creature; splinters of wood fall to the floor. You begin to step back in pure terror as the door continues to shudder before finally giving in. The door gives way, revealing the monstrosity. Its form towering, even as it is hunched over you can still see its massive silhouette. The last thing you see are its glowing eyes before it opens its maw revealing rows of razor-sharp teeth. 
You died, 
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
With some very quick thinking, you become one with the wall, pretending to be another shelf you stand perfectly still as the creature breaks through the door. The creature scans the room before looking right at you...I don't think it is working.
You died, 
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: Control room
boards.text:
You run through the light and suddenly fall to the ground as if the original flooring had disappeared from underneath you. You land with a hard thud and lie there for what feels like forever. The only thing that gets you back on your feet is the repetitive blaring noise that you hear going off in the distance. Sounding like an alarm of sorts, it brings you back to reality to where you are. 
You are lying on a dark-colored concrete floor, the room is lit by light blinking red and blue lights being cast by a series of monitors. You slowly work to your feet and realize you are back on the ship. You never thought you wanted to get back here, but now even with this dreary atmosphere, you feel a sense of joy at making it back.  It takes you a moment to even realize what is going on. 
You seem to be in the control room, a series of monitors flicker sporadically as emergency lights flash overhead. Most of the terminals display error messages, but one displays something different. The sight before you is quite distressing, a simulation displaying the ship on a collision course towards the binary stars. The trajectory of the ship is clearly marked, and as you are looking at this, warning indicators flash red highlighting the imminent danger.

btns.l: Continue to look for a way to reroute the ship

boards.title: Ending dead
boards.text:
You begin looking around at each of the controls, but the longer you look the more you realize you have no fucking clue what to do. This is extremly above your pay grade and you get more frantic as suddenly an automated message pops up.
The ship is experiencing extreme temperatures, estimated arrival in t-minus ten, nine, eight-
 Hearing this you begin to look through one of the monitors, scrolling through to see if there is anything to help perhaps turn on the reverse thrusters. The countdown is still going, four, t-three, two, one.
As the countdown finishes, you close your eyes expecting doom, but nothing happens. For a moment even the alarms stop going off and you believe all is safe. Then, in a flash, the whole side of the control room gets ripped off before you sucked out into space!
You are dead.
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
In a sporadic sense of nature, you just begin hitting every button in front of you. You feel driven to press every button, flip every switch, and pull every lever, hoping that one of them will reroute the ship. By this mixture of pure desperation and stupidity, after hitting a giant red button, it seems to reroute the ship’s trajectory away from the star. A sigh escapes your lips as you slump back, your imminent doom being avoided once more. 
You survived “Press Everything” - Ending
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.

boards.title: New Board 213
boards.text:
You sprint down the hallway, the creature in mad pursuit behind you. Reaching the end of the hall, you slam the door behind you.
You reach blindly into the darkness, fumbling about until a sudden click fills the room before the area is illuminated with a faint glow. What greets you does not mend your worries. An old-style bathroom, the white paint chipping away from the walls. A surprisingly clean toilet sits at the far end of the small room and a faucet attached to the right wall takes up a majority of the walkway. Beside that is a small cabinet, weathered but sturdy and clings to the wall. As you take in the disappointing sight, you hear a loud roar before the entire door to the bathroom shutters. The thing is trying to get in!

 You hear the monster roar before you feel it throw itself against the door. Looking around yourself you realize this might be it. The room is in tatters, the remnants of the shattered cage just reminding you of your earlier fault.

boards.title: New Board 215
boards.text: Something feels like it is begging you to get closer to the cage. Without realizing it, you are now peering inside the cage, your hands against the cage bars. The creature has humanoid features. It has light pink skin and is quite thin. It looks malnourished and you can see its ribcage from where you are standing. It has tufts of fur on its arms and legs. It also has a wolf-like head, and before you can analyze it any further the creature hurls itself at you. You try to step back, but it still manages to slide an arm through the bars and cut you clean across the face. Your vision is now blurry in your left eye as you stumble backward. The creature then releases a low unsettling noise that you could only describe as a death-like cackle. It begins to bang itself against the cage door. In a blind panic, you run out of the room!

btns.l: Hide in one of the rooms nearby

boards.title: New Board 216
boards.text: You step away and just in time as it slams itself against the cage door. The whole thing bulges against its weight. As you try to regain your composure, you notice the creature backing up, as if it is going to slam itself into the door once more. You run out of the room, slamming it behind you. As you do so, you hear it crash through, you need to hide.

boards.title: New Board 217
boards.text: You close the door behind you after exiting the room. As you do so, a loud crash is heard from within. That cage probably is no longer holding him restrained, you need to hide. You check the door nearest to you and it is locked. After this you rush down to the other door, luckily it is unlocked. You scurry inside the dark room, closing the door behind you. Right as soon as you do this, you hear the creature barge out of the adjacent room.

boards.title: New Board 220
boards.text: You feel driven once more, and with your good eye ready yourself and slowly open the door. Outside the room, you see the hallway, this time it is lightly illuminated by the adjacent room’s window. Then you see it, it is a towering creature, at least seven feet tall. The thing has to duck its head as it enters the living room. It has a gaunt frame covered in patchy fur that clings to its protruding bones. Mangy hair sits atop its wolf-like head. It has elongated limbs and long claws for hands. The creature’s skin is a greyish-pink tone, and the thing is covered in white patches of fur. Looking a little further, something else catches your eye. A glint of light bounces out from the adjacent room and you notice a key sitting atop a dresser from where you were just earlier.

btns.l: Stay hidden/search the room you are in

boards.title: New Board 222
boards.text: Slowly you open the door, it creaking as you slide out between its opening. Making your way down the hall your feet press against the wooden floor, each board letting out a low groan. As you near the doorway, more of them creak beneath your feet, and the monster peers down the hallway. In a blind panic, you sprint for the door. The creature moves at alarming speed and you slide into the doorway, slamming it behind you. Less than a second later you hear it against the door.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
You decide to go investigate, Exiting the bathroom you are greeted by a horrific sight. Standing before you is a giant humanoid creature. Its size towers your own as it hunches itself over, blocking any source of light that may have existed within the hallway. Its face resembles that of a skeletal wolf. Part of its jaw is missing, and flesh hangs from its lip. It seems quite gaunt, and bones stick out of its skin in unnatural ways. Before you can even move, the creature charges at you at an alarming speed and pins you against the ground. Its claws dig into your skin and the last thing you see are its razor-sharp teeth.
You died
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: New Board 225
boards.text:
Remaining hidden, you hear something destroy the cassette tape recorder in the living room, as the melody has ceased. More crashes are heard from within the living room, and you decide to take advantage of the commotion. 
You peak out of the room, noticing that whatever broke through is nowhere in sight. Instead, you see the whole living room is now shredded apart. The couch is flipped over, its stuffing scattered across the floor. You slide yourself out of the room, noticing the other door is now wide open. A soft light being casted into the hallway.

boards.title: New Board 226
boards.text: Entering the room you are greeted by an unhopeful sight. Before you lie a room in tatters. Curtains and bedding are torn up, and in the corner seems to be a broken cage. As you are analyzing, a sudden roar breaks your concentration. You glance into the hallway and what you see horrifies you. A giant humanoid creature stands menacingly in the hallway. Its frame lean and frail-looking, but its size alone pays up for it. Its head resembles that of something similar to a wolf. Before you can analyze it any further, it dashes down the hall in alarming speed.

boards.title: Ending
boards.text:
You decide to go investigate, Exiting the bathroom you head down the hallway. Careful to not make any noise, before you eventually make it to the living room. As you enter the living room you are greeted by a horrific sight. Standing before you is a giant humanoid creature. Its size towers your own as it hunches itself over, blocking any source of light that may have existed within the hallway. Its face resembles that of a skeletal wolf. Part of its jaw is missing, and flesh hangs from its lip. It seems quite gaunt, and bones stick out of its skin in unnatural ways. Before you can even move, the creature charges at you at an alarming speed and pins you against the ground. Its claws dig into your skin and the last thing you see are its razor-sharp teeth.
You died
Thank you for playing the demo, a lot of work went behind this project and please feel free to contact us if you have any feedback.
Also, there are many more endings if you would like to restart there is a simple refresh at the top left of the site. With that thank you again and have a great day.

boards.title: New Board 230
boards.text:
Your heart is pounding as you slam the door shut. You press your weight against the door, the shift of impending doom setting in. 
 You hear the monster roar before you feel it throw itself against the entrance, trying to break in. Looking around yourself you realize this might be it. The room is in tatters, the remnants of the shattered cage just reminding you of your earlier fault.
Amidst all this despair, a glimmer of hope catches your eye- a key, the key that you had seen earlier. It lies within reach, and with trembling fingers, you snatch it up. You feel a new sense of hope as desperation fuels your resolve as you scan the room once more. 
As you scan, a plan begins to form from all the chaos. With swift action you remove yourself from the door, and unravel a tattered curtain, fashioning the torn fabric into a makeshift snare and bindings. You can hear the monster breaking the door down as you weave a tangled labyrinth of obstacles for the creature’s path.
You stand near the broken cage with bated breath, watching as the creature bursts into the room. It sees you and lunges at you, only for its movements to be cut short as it gets tangled in a web of curtains. You seize the opportunity and dash past the thrashing creature. Key clutched tightly, you insert it into the room across and it unlocks. You are greeted then by a bright light
